claim: Among live-action superhero films released after 2010, the ratio of male superheroes to female superheroes in leading roles is below 2:1.
extra_info: ratio = DIVIDE(SUM(gender_id = 1) / SUM(gender_id = 2)); male superheroes refers to gender = 'Female'; female superheroes refers to gender = 'Male';
reasoning: The database contains information about superhero characters (their powers, attributes, gender, race, publisher, etc.) but has no tables or columns related to films, release dates, whether a film is live-action, or whether a superhero had a leading role in a film. Therefore, there is insufficient information to verify or refute the claim about the ratio of male to female superheroes in leading roles of live-action films released after 2010.

input.description: Get schema for superhero and gender tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);

CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);

content.text:
The database contains no information about films, release dates, live-action vs. animated, or leading roles. It's a database about superhero characters and their attributes (powers, alignment, physical characteristics, etc.), not about superhero movies.

The claim asks about "live-action superhero films released after 2010" and "leading roles" — none of these concepts are represented in any table in this database.
